intro: Psychotria bryonicola, commonly known as the "ghost plant," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its small, dark green leaves and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid rainforests. Psychotria bryonicola is also noted for its potential ethnobotanical significance in traditional medicine.
